column4: after support fo tht version dies there will be no more updates and it will not be supported here
if you buy phone support you will be advised about upgrades
as far as updating goes, is it like moving from windows xp to windows vista or is it less of a pain then that?
not really, its the same apps in the same place, just a newer kernel and newer versions of your favourite apps
unless you esstablish it you never pay. its always free
you need the amd64 iso if you want to take full advantage of your cpu
its slightly different but the transition should be relatively painless
sure, make a script with the update commands you like then use cron to cron the updates
does the cd pass self check?
i don't know how to check that
did you burn the cd slowly
how can i check that for you?
on first boot screen select check cd for defects
i don't know your definitely of slowly, but it was 30x
you should also md5 check all iso files you download
bun as slow as the meia will allow, 8x is advised, 4x if you can
i'll give it a shot. thanks for the help
try turnng hardware off in bios too
and press f6 on the first boot screen to disable apic acpi and dma
it actually has all of those issues with the usb drive... so do i need to re-burn the cd still?
check the iso with md5 sum, you may have a bad  file
then burn slowly and then boot to the cd, then run the self test
if its ok, try a boot. if not use boot options
